relation: Major cleanup and rewrite (done, except for the new highscore classes) Release team: please link to the porting instructions for third-party developers
Use KGameRenderer and QGraphicsView for all graphics: the gameplay is the same as before.
Remove the status bar. All scores and status messages are in the viewport now.
Allow the displayed speed of moves to be adjusted.
Animate multi-stage moves, to make it easier for a human player to follow their progress.
Show multi-stage moves in an order that is easier to follow.
Validate the loading of saved games and report errors.
Rewrite the main AI class and make it use a true Minimax method.
Provide a choice of two AI styles, Kepler and Newton, with the possibility to add more.
Add settings to choose computer player, AI style and skill level for either or both of players 1 and 2.
Add board sizes 3x3 and 4x4, for simplified play.
Add a simple Print facility for KSudoku puzzles.
Add new game, Picmi: A nonogram logic game for KDE.
pageTitle: Difference between revisions of "Schedules/KDE4/4.10 Feature Plan" - KDE TechBase

textAfterTable: TO DO kwin windows that are moved to another desktop should be treated as sticky windows (bug #213847) <kwin-bugs-null@kde.org> TO DO kwin Fix fullscreen state handling: NETWM says it's bound to focus and not stacking order, also see bug #224600 (bug #296076) <kwin-bugs-null@kde.org> TO DO kwin Medium focus stealing prevention should also prevent focus stealing when the timestamp on the active window is uncertain (bug #304746) <kwin-bugs-null@kde.org> TO DO kwin Usability issue: "Attach as tab to" menu can be empty (bug #306451) <kwin-bugs-null@kde.org> TO DO kwin Import Scripted Effect from All Effets Tab (bug #296772) <kwin-bugs-null@kde.org>
